title: Live Updates: Kenyan President Vows to Prevent Violence ‘At Whatever Cost’
content: President Ruto spoke after demonstrators in Nairobi breached the Parliament to protest the passage of a bill raising taxes on many basics. At least five people were killed, according to Amnesty International and several civic organizations.
summary: President Ruto spoke after demonstrators in Nairobi breached the Parliament to protest the passage of a bill raising taxes on many basics. At least five people were killed, according to Amnesty International and several civic organizations.

title: Russia Committed Human Rights Violations in Crimea, European Court Finds
content: The European Court of Human Rights listed multiple violations. Its findings paint a grim picture of life under a decade of Russian occupation.

title: Middle East Crisis: Gaza Famine Warning Spurs Calls to Remove Restrictions on Food Shipments
content: A U.N.-backed panel of experts said the war with Hamas had created a catastrophic lack of food, but stopped short of declaring a famine.

title: Israel’s Supreme Court Rules Ultra-Orthodox Jews Must Be Drafted Into Military
content: The court ruled there was no legal justification for the ultra-Orthodox exemption from service, a decision that threatened to split Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s wartime government.
summary: The court ruled there was no legal justification for the ultra-Orthodox exemption from service, a decision that threatened to split Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s wartime government.

title: France’s Far-Right National Rally Rebranded Itself. Here’s How.

title: Kenyan-Led Forces Arrive in Haiti After Months of Gang Violence

title: Kenyan Lawmakers Pass Contentious Tax Rises Despite Protests
content: Demonstrators were met with tear gas, and live fire rang out as they marched on Parliament in an attempt to stop the vote. The bill now goes to President William Ruto, who campaigned on helping the poor but has backed the tax increases and said they are necessary.
summary: Demonstrators were met with tear gas, and live fire rang out as they marched on Parliament in an attempt to stop the vote. The bill now goes to President William Ruto, who campaigned on helping the poor but has backed the tax increases and said they are necessary.

title: Russia Tightens Grip on Wagner Units in Africa, Year After Failed Mutiny
